## Background

I created these flashcards to help students learn about evals in our [AI Evals course](https://evals.info){target="_blank"}.

If you are new to evals, I recommend starting with the [Evals FAQ](/blog/posts/evals-faq/){target="_blank"}. For something lighter, check out the [Evals Memes](../memes/){target="_blank"}.

## Flashcards

Click on any image to open it full-size, or use the download button in the corner to save it directly.

::: {.testimonial-section}
```{python}
#| echo: false
#| output: asis
#| cache: false

from pathlib import Path
import re

template = """
::: {{.testimonial .g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}}

[![]({image})]({image}){{target="_blank"}}

<div class="card-number">{number}</div>

<a href="{image}" download class="download-icon" title="Download">
  <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" fill="none"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" d="M4 16v1a3 3 0 003 3h10a3 3 0 003-3v-1m-4-4l-4 4m0 0l-4-4m4 4V4"/></svg>
</a>

:::
"""

header = """::: {.content-block .grid .gap-4}
"""

footer = """
:::
"""

# Get all image files from directory (exclude cover.png)
flashcard_dir = Path(".")
images = [f.name for f in flashcard_dir.iterdir()
          if f.suffix.lower() in ['.png', '.jpeg', '.jpg']
          and f.name != 'cover.png']

# Sort by leading number (e.g., "1-error-analysis.png" -> 1)
def get_leading_number(filename):
    match = re.match(r'^(\d+)', filename)
    return int(match.group(1)) if match else float('inf')

images = sorted(images, key=get_leading_number)

print(header)
for i, img in enumerate(images, 1):
    print(template.format(image=img, number=i))
print(footer)
```
